questions.text: Bullying is always intentional.

remediation.text: Bullying is always intentional.

questions.text: When bullying occurs there is always a difference in power.

remediation.text: Part of the definition of bullying is that bullies have more power than their victims.

questions.text: A friend who acts differently when others are around and often ignores you or leaves you out is called a:

remediation.text: A friend who acts differently when others are around, or ignores you is called a frenemy.

questions.text: Sometimes acting like a frenemy is a normal part of true friendship.

remediation.text: Being a frenemy is not how true friends treat each other.

questions.text: Lindsey’s friend Ava teases her a lot. At first it didn’t bother Lindsey, but now it does. She’s told Ava to stop, but she won’t. Is this bullying?

remediation.text: This is an example of bullying.

questions.text: Which of the following is an example of indirect bullying?

remediation.text: Gossiping, or talking about someone behind their backs, is an example of indirect bullying.

questions.text: Which of the following is an example of direct bullying?

remediation.text: Damaging someone’s personal property is an example of direct bullying.

questions.text: Indirect bullying is done face to face.

remediation.text: Indirect bullying is done behind someone’s back.

questions.text: What is it called when a bully uses technology to bully others?

remediation.text: When a bully uses technology, like a computer, the internet or a cell phone to bully others, it’s called cyberbullying.

questions.text: Which of the following is an example of cyberbullying?

option.text: Both a and b are cyberbullying

remediation.text: Both sending mean texts and spreading rumors online are examples of cyberbulling.

questions.text: A person who intentionally harms another person is known as a:

remediation.text: A person who intentionally harms another person is called a bully.

questions.text: Someone who observes a bullying situation is a:

remediation.text: Someone who observes a bullying situation is called a bystander.

questions.text: The target of a bully is known as the:

remediation.text: The target of a bully is known as the victim.

questions.text: The "C" in A.C.T. stands for:

remediation.text: The "C" in A.C.T. stands for care.

questions.text: The "A" in A.C.T. stands for:

remediation.text: The "A" in A.C.T. stands for action.

questions.text: The "T" in A.C.T. stands for:

remediation.text: The "T" in A.C.T. stands for tell.

questions.text: Bullying is typically not repeated over time.

remediation.text: Bullying is usually repeated over time.

questions.text: Two ways to take action and stop a bullying situation are:

remediation.text: Speaking up and seeking help are two ways to take action.

questions.text: Firmly telling the bully to "knock it off" is an example of a:

remediation.text: Firmly telling a bully to "knock it off" is an example of a strong assertive comeback.

questions.text: Responding to a bully by saying "whatever" in a normal voice would be an example of a:

remediation.text: Responding to a bully by saying "whatever" in a normal voice is an example of a no reaction comeback.

questions.text: If a bully is making fun of you and you respond by saying "You’re right", you are using which type of comeback?

remediation.text: Saying "you’re right" is an agreement comeback.

questions.text: It’s important to tell an adult about a bullying situation, even if the bullying has stopped.

remediation.text: It is important to tell an adult about a bullying situation, even if the bullying has stopped.

questions.text: Which of the following can show a victim that you care?

option.text: Offering to go with the victim to report the bullying
Walking away from the bullying situation
Not laughing at what the bully is doing

remediation.text: Offering to go with the victim to report the bullying shows the victim that you care.

questions.text: Which of these is the best way to show a victim that you care?

option.text: Refusing to be the bully’s friend
Talking to the victim later on

remediation.text: Talking to the victim later on to offer your support is a great way to show the victim that you care.

questions.text: Which of the following can show a victim that you care?

option.text: Smiling at them as they are being bullied
Writing a note to the bully telling them they are mean
Inviting the victim to join your group

remediation.text: Inviting the victim to join your group really shows the victim that you care.

questions.text: Which of these is usually done just to try and get someone in trouble?

remediation.text: Tattling is usually done just to try and get someone in trouble.

questions.text: It is every student’s responsibility to tell an adult when they see bullying.

remediation.text: It is every student’s responsibility to tell an adult when they see bullying.

questions.text: In gym class as Tyler passed the basketball to David, it hit him in the head. Tyler said he was sorry and the game continued. Is this bullying?

remediation.text: This is not bullying. It sounds like it was an accident.

questions.text: When you use an agreement comeback, you are not giving the bully the response that they’re looking for.

remediation.text: When you use an agreement comeback you are not giving the bully the response that they’re looking for.

questions.text: Tattling is just another name for telling.

remediation.text: Telling is very important when someone could get hurt and it is not tattling.

questions.text: To minimize a bullying situation, the best thing to do is nothing.

remediation.text: Doing nothing will not stop bullying. Remember A.C.T. to take Action, Care for the victim and Tell an adult.

questions.text: When using a no reaction comeback, you should respond calmly, as if the bully is not bothering you at all.

remediation.text: When using a no reaction comeback, you need to respond calmly, as if the bully is not bothering you at all.

questions.text: A.C.T. stands for

remediation.text: A.C.T. stands for Action Care Tell.

questions.text: A.C.T. is a way to help

option.text: Students get into a good college

remediation.text: A.C.T. is a way to help end bullying at your school when everyone remembers: Action, Care, Tell!
